subject: Bicycles and Bicycling
lead_paragraph: Lance Armstrong wants to return to elite racing in January’s Tour Down Under in Australia even though he is not eligible to return until Feb. 1, 2009. The race runs Jan. 20-25. Armstrong said he hoped authorities would grant him an exemption. The International Cycling Union (U.C.I.) requires riders coming out of retirement to be in the sport’s antidoping program for six months before racing. Armstrong filed paperwork Aug. 1 with the United States Anti-Doping Agency and said he was tested in late August. The U.C.I. has said it will make a decision this week.
